required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Real-time and Computerized Sonographic Reporting System in Predicting Malignant Cervical Lymphadenopathy
clinical_study.official_title: A Real-time and Computerized Sonographic Scoring System for Predicting Malignant Cervical Lymphadenopathy

brief_summary.textblock: The investigaotors want to establish a real-time and computerized score reporting system based on the significant predictors of the measured sonographic parameters and demographic data.

detailed_description.textblock: One hundred eight patients with neck lymphadenopathy, receiving ultrasonography and ultrasound-guided fine-needle aspiration (US-FNA), were used to construct a predictive model. This model was validated by another independent patient cohort.

primary_outcome.measure: The final diagnoses of lymph nodes were made by US-FNA cytological studies, pathologic results of the biopsy specimens, or at least 3 months of negative follow-up observations.

arm_group.description: Patients with previously untreated neck masses

study_pop.textblock: patients with previously untreated neck masses were referred for sonographic evaluation and subsequent US-FNA after informed consent was obtained. Demographic data, including age and sex, side, site, and number of lymphadenopathy was collected as well.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with previously untreated neck masses underwent neck US
Exclusion Criteria:
- The neck mass was not lymph node
- No US-FNA cytology result

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Otolaryngology, Far Eastern Memorial Hospital, Taipei, Taiwan

link.description: Real-time and computerized sonographic scoring system for predicting malignant cervical lymphadenopathy

results_reference.citation: Liao LJ, Wang CT, Young YH, Cheng PW. Real-time and computerized sonographic scoring system for predicting malignant cervical lymphadenopathy. Head Neck. 2010 May;32(5):594-8. doi: 10.1002/hed.21225.

responsible_party.organization: Far Eastern Memorial Hospital, Taipei, Taiwan
